intro: Paepalanthus koernickeanus, commonly known as the Brazilian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that resemble sunflowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and is adapted to tropical climates. It has a short stem with large, broad leaves and produces numerous small, yellow florets arranged in a composite flower head. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid environments.
